'''Duosion''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ダブラン''' ''Doublan'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Solosis}} starting at [[level]] 32 and evolves into {{p|Reuniclus}} starting at level 41.

==Biology==
Duosion is pale green with a large head, stubby arms, and a body that tapers to a point at the bottom. It has oval, black eyes and a red, diamond-shaped mouth. It is encased in a darker green, gelatinous substance that forms small, round bumps on the lower sides and over Duosion's head. A small circular piece of matter floats inside this substance over this Pokémon's head. It has two brains, which occasionally causes it to attempt two different actions at once. However, its exhibits greater psychic powers when the brains think alike.

==In the anime==
[[File:Officer Jenny Duosion.png|thumb|left|250px|Duosion in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
An army of {{p|Solosis}} and Duosion debuted in both versions of ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]'', under the ownership of [[Damon]].

A Duosion appeared in ''[[BW045|Beheeyem, Duosion, and the Dream Thief!]]'', under the ownership of an [[Officer Jenny]]. It was used to help locate a so-called "[[Leon|Dream Thief]]".

===Minor appearances===
A Duosion appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW120|Ash and N: A Clash of Ideals!]]''.

A Duosion appeared in ''[[XY092|Cloudy Fate, Bright Future!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Psychic}}.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS478|Big City Battles]]'', a Duosion was briefly seen under the ownership of one of [[Castelia City]]'s residents.

{{adv|White}}'s {{p|Solosis}}, Solly, was revealed to have evolved into a Duosion in [[PS541]].

==Trivia==
* Duosion has the highest Special Attack base stat of all non-fully evolved Pokémon.

===Origin===
Duosion and the rest of its evolutionary line seem to bear reference to {{wp|Cell (biology)|cells}}, with the green substance surrounding their bodies resembling {{wp|cytoplasm}} and the objects inside their bodies representing {{wp|Organelle|organelles}}. The line down its head also resembles a {{wp|cleavage furrow}} due to {{wp|mitosis}}. It may also make allusion to the {{wp|Embryogenesis|embryonary stages}}, specifically when the embryo is fully developed to become into a {{wp|fetus}}, while the green jelly may represent the {{wp|amniotic fluid}}.

====Name origin====
Duosion may be a combination of ''duo'' (two) or ''double'' and ''{{wp|fission (biology)|fission}}'', ''{{wp|cell division|division}}'', or ''{{wp|Cell fusion|fusion}}''.

Doublan may be a combination of ''double'' and 卵 ''ran'' (spawn).
